etymons.meaning: to loosen; to unload; to uncover, reveal

Preterit.turoyo: šari u=baṣrodə-druʕe d-u=zʕurokule b-lalyošarənak=kalamčawat me iḏe d-Fawlus LB 179; hammahiyehawxa, šreḥaṣo, qayəmkət-yo 381; 97/63;
translations: whole boy’s arm skin separated (from his

Infectum.turoyo: daqăna i=daḥṯošəryo 357; 115/44; (примеротсутствует в указанномместе); g-šorenoruhi m-i…m-ano, m-u=qays-ano LB 156;

translations: ‘Every day he (doctor, m.) came and unbound it (arm, m.) and put the salve on it and then bandaged it again’

Imperativ.turoyo: u=qoḏ̣emadile l-u=abro, omər tox šray u=zənǧər me-qḏoli 372; prs 181/6; qayimiqralle l-u=qaḏ̣imərre «məttafaqlan. daxīldiḏux! šri-lan!»
translations: ‘They called the judge and said: “We came to an agreement with each other. We beg you to set us free!”’; 39/28 [MT]

Preterit.turoyo: me-tamomšarelikṯuli a=kṯowe d-a=ṣlawoṯe d-i=ʕito, yaʕnifanqiyoṯe w-ḥusoye w-a=kṯoweḥrenexd-u=ʕmoḏo w-d-u=beroxo w-d-u=lewoyo w-mgalyune
translations: ‘From there I began to copy ecclesiastical prayer books that are the Psalms, prayer books and other books such as books on christening, wedding, funeral ceremonies, and the Gospel’; 37/14 [MT]
